intro: Rinorea castaneoides var. strictiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered rinorea, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the wild.
